column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to [[George Allen and Unwin|George Allen & Unwin]]'''.<ref>{{CG|C}}

column1: *'''Contents:''': Tolkien writes to his publishers regarding the promotion of ''[[The Hobbit]]''. Notable is Tolkien's description of his friend [[Wilfred Rowland Childe]].
''"[Wilfred Rowland Childe is] specially interested in elves and related creatures. He was (once at any rate) a fairly well-known poet
column2: and is still a good one; and is in close touch with various literary and journalistic sets & folk
column3: in the North specially. He would probably do something
column4: if he got a copy. He saw the [manuscript] and is well disposed"''
